thread.title: Driver parks next to car with identical make, colour and number plate - the explanation is criminal
thread.title_full: Driver parks next to car with identical make, colour and number plate - the explanation is criminal

author: mirror
title: Driver parks next to car with identical make, colour and number plate - the explanation is criminal
text:
The woman was concerned by the plates (Photo: BPM Media) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A woman thought she was seeing double when she parked next to the same car, with an identical number plate, at a garden centre. 
She decided to call the police after seeing a vehicle matching her white Ford Kuga in the car park â€“ displaying exactly the same registration plate. 
When officers arrived at Melbicks Garden centre in Coleshill they found two vehicles parked opposite each other, showing twin number plates. Read More Reckless driver caught after uploading footage of him taunting cops during wild police chase to Instagram 
Upon further examination it was discovered that one of Kugas was actually a stolen vehicle that was taken from Birmingham in 2016. 
Its true identity had been masked by the fake plate which, if checked, would come back to a genuine Ford Kuga of the same colour. The police investigated and found one of the cars was stolen (Photo: BPM Media) 
The vehicle contained a number of items connected with burglaries across the West Midlands and inquiries are ongoing into the theft of the vehicle. 
The legitimate owner of the vehicle was made aware of the fraud after she phone up on on Monday, January 30. Read More 
A spokesman for Warwickshire Police confirmed the mind-boggling incident took place and is asking members of the public to call 101 if they have any information. Like us on Facebook
